comment._content: New York Times - September 16, 1913: "CLASS LINES VANISH AT SULLIVAN BURIAL; Judges and Senators Mix with Thieves and Gangsters for Last Tribute to Dead Leader." query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9C03E2D8123FE633A... query.nytimes.com/mem/archive-free/pdf?res=9C03E2D8123FE6...

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Charles Francis Murphy was the boss of New York's Tammany political machine until his death in 1924.

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: "Thomas J. McManus (March 4, 1864 in New York City – July 30, 1926 in Manhattan, New York City) was an American politician from New York. During his political career he became known as "The" McManus." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thomas_J._McManus
